citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pelomonas saccharophila comb. nov.
Pelomonas saccharophila (sac.cha.ro.phi′la. Gr. n. saccharon sugar; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. fem. adj. saccharophila sugar-loving).
The characteristics are the same as those in the description of the genus, with the following additions.
Cells are 3·0–4·0 μm long and 0·5 μm in diameter.
Growth occurs at 4–40 °C with an optimum at 25–32 °C; unable to grow at 41 °C.

The following enzymes are present: 2-keto-3-deoxy-6-phosphogalactonate aldolase, 2-keto-3-deoxy-6-phosphogluconate aldolase, d-galactose dehydrogenase, mannose isomerase, pullulanase, sucrose phosphorylase and α-amylase.

d-Galactose, mannose, d-ribose, glucose, fructose, sucrose, d-xylose, rhamnose, glutarate, acetate, pyruvate, butyrate, lactate, l-malate, succinate, fumarate, citrate, l-proline and isobutanol are utilized as carbon sources for growth, but not glycerol, mannitol, sorbitol, ethanol, glycine, l-lysine, suberate, azelate or l-serine.
The type strain is IAM 14368T (=ATCC 15946T=CFBP 2433T=CIP 59.18T=DSM 654T=HAMBI 373T=LMG 2256T=NCCB 46053T=VKM B-902T), which was isolated from mud of a stagnant pool.
